intro: Veronica scrophularioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved speedwell, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer. Veronica scrophularioides is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
